questions.question_text: Which statement about SAN port channels configured on Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches is true?

choices.B: SAN port channels can include up to 16 interfaces.
choices.A: A single SAN port channel can have both Fibre Channel and virtual Fibre Channel interfaces.
choices.E: The On mode of operation means ports only operate as part of a SAN port channel or remain inactive.
choices.D: The links in SAN port channels can be connected to different sets of switches.
choices.C: SAN port channels distribute traffic across all links in the port channel when source ID and destination ID load balancing are used.

discussion.content:
yes!
On (default)—The member ports only operate as part of a SAN port channel or remain inactive.

choices.D: vPC member ports forming the PortChannel
choices.A: Two peer devices: the vPC peers of which one is primary and one is secondary and are part of a vPC domain.
choices.F: A management port that can be used as peer-keepalive link to resolve dual-active scenarios.
choices.B: A Layer 3 Gigabit Ethernet link called peer-keepalive link to resolve dual-active scenarios
choices.E: A dot1q trunk between the vPC peers
choices.C: A redundant 10 Gigabit Ethernet PortChannel called a peer link to carry traffic from one system to the other when needed

questions.question_text: Virtual PortChannels (vPCs) allow links that are physically connected to two different Cisco switches to appear to a third downstream device as coming from a single device and as part of a single port channel. Which of the following are components of a Virtual PortChannel system? (Choose four)

discussion.content:
yes!
 Two peer devices: the vPC peers of which one is primary and one is secondary and are part of a vPC domain.
● A Layer 3 Gigabit Ethernet link called peer-keepalive link to resolve dual-active scenarios
● A redundant 10 Gigabit Ethernet PortChannel called a peer link to carry traffic from one system to the other
when needed
● vPC member ports forming the PortChannel

choices.A: It's hard-set and cannot be disabled
choices.C: It's hard-set but cannot disable best-effort and Fibre Channel
choices.D: It's hard-set but can disable all but one class
choices.B: It's configurable, with an upper limit of 16
choices.E: It's configurable with an upper limit of eight

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about the number of available QoS system classes in FCoE?

discussion.content: D is incorrect. it's the original answer, BE and FC

D
The Cisco Nexus 5500 Series device supports five user-defined classes and one default drop system class.

questions.question_text: How many VSM modes are there in a Cisco Nexus 1000V environment?
